Bronze characters (1)

昬字的基本解释

昬
hūn
古同“昏”。

昬字的汉语字典释义

[①]［hūn］
［《廣韻》呼昆切，平魂，曉。］
亦作“昬1”。亦作“2”。
(1)天刚黑的时候；傍晚。
(2)昏暗；无光。
(3)指使昏暗。
(4)昏聩；糊涂；迷乱。
(5)谓使糊涂。
(6)指世道混乱、黑暗。
(7)谓使世道昏乱。
(8)漫漶；模糊。
(9)目不明；昏花。
(10)昏厥；失去知觉。
(11)结婚。后多作“婚”。
(12)指通婚。
(13)通“閽”。古代守门的官。
[②]［mǐn］
亦作“昬2”。
(1)通“”。勉力，尽力。
(2)通“泯”。轻蔑。参见“昏2棄”。
(3)通“泯”。没；死。

昬字的康熙字典解释

【辰集上】【日字部】　昬； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页493第20
【正字通】同昏。唐本《說文》从民省，徐本从氐省。晁補之云：因唐諱民，改从氏，則昬非俗字明矣。《精薀》以昬爲昬旦之昬，以昏爲昏姻之昏，蓋不考唐諱昬改从氏，遂分爲二字也。

Zhu
Basic explanation of words
Zhu
hūn
Gu Tong "fainted."
Zhu
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［hūn］
["Guangyun" Hu Kunqie, Ping Hun, Xiao. ]
Also known as "昬1". Also called "2".
(1) When it is just dark; in the evening.
(2) Dim; no light.
(3) Make it dim.
(4) Faint; confused; confused.
(5) Said to be confused.
(6) Refers to the chaos and darkness of the world.
(7) Said to make the world confused.
(8) Diffuse; fuzzy.
(9) Unknown eyes; dim.
(10) Fainting; loss of consciousness.
(11) Get married. Later, it was often called "marriage."
(12) Refers to intermarriage.
(13) Through "阍". An ancient gatekeeper.
[②]［mǐn］
Also known as "昬2".
(1) Pass "". Try hard, do your best.
(2) Through "泯". Contempt. See "Faint 2 Abandoned".
(3) Through "泯". not dead.
Zhu
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji 1] [Japanese Character Department] 　昬; Kangxi strokes: 9; Page number: page 493 20
【Zhengzitong】Same as faint. The Tang version of "Shuowen" was from the Minsheng Province, and the Xu version was from Di Province. Chao Buzhiyun: Because of the Tang taboo people, changing the Congshi, it is clear that Zhu is not a vulgar word. "Jingxu" regards Zun as the Zun of Dan, and faint as the faint of marriage. It is divided into two characters without examining Tang Taboo and changing to Congshi.
Zhu
